content.text: We view parents as essential partners in the educational journey. Open, two-way communication builds trust and supports student success.

content.label: Response Time
content.text: Staff are expected to respond to parent emails within 24 working hours.
Formal meetings to discuss academic progress and social-emotional development.

items: Scheduled twice a year (typically mid-Semester 1 and mid-Semester 2).
Student-Led Conferences (SLCs) are encouraged in Primary grades to promote agency.
Ad-hoc meetings can be requested by parents or teachers at any time.

content.text: The Parent Association supports the school community through events, fundraising, and feedback.

content.title: Role
items: Organizing community events (e.g., Family Day, International Day).
Supporting school projects and charity initiatives.
Serving as a liaison for general parent feedback (not individual grievances).

content.text: The school takes concerns seriously and aims to resolve them constructively and locally.

steps.title: Teacher
steps.desc: Discuss the concern directly with the subject or homeroom teacher.

steps.title: Head of Department/Level
steps.desc: If unresolved, escalate to the relevant middle leader.

steps.title: Principal
steps.desc: If still unresolved, meet with the School Principal.

steps.title: Board/Foundation
steps.desc: Formal written grievance to the Board for serious policy breaches.
